definition: (of an animal) to paw (the ground)
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
surname Bao
to flee from sth/to run away/to escape
racing bicycle/sporting bicycle/sports car/logging truck/on the job (of a train conductor)
athletic track/track/runway (i.e. airstrip)
to run/to jog/(military) to march at the double
to run
long-distance running
to start running/the start of a race
the starting line (of a race)/scratch line (in a relay race)
jogging/to jog/to canter/a slow trot
race (running)/to race (running)

to run around all over the place

sentences.english: It was easily good enough for pole so that was the main thing.
sentences.chinese: 那一圈跑得不错，足以使我获得杆位，那是最主要的。

sentences.english: B. Replan the project without the resources.
sentences.chinese: 跑去资源重新计划该项目。

sentences.english: The brother and sister quickly ran.
The travellers were dismayed to find the bridge had been wash away.
sentences.chinese: 旅行者们发现桥被冲跑了，很沮丧。

sentences.english: Later, those boats were heavily outrun by modern ships.
sentences.chinese: 稍后，那些船很重地根据现代船跑得更快。

sentences.english: The thief had run more than forty miles.
sentences.chinese: 那个小偷已经跑了四十多里路。

sentences.english: At this moment the cannon of the harbor is heard firing, and Suzuki hurries in, saying that it is a warship.
sentences.chinese: 就在这时港口一声炮响，铃木跑进来说是一艘军舰。

sentences.english: Sampras run forward to hit an overhead shot.
sentences.chinese: 桑普拉斯跑向前打了一个过头球。

sentences.english: This paper main studies on the impact of knife gap and run slanting to shear quality.
sentences.chinese: 本文主要研究剪刃间隙及跑偏对钢板边部质量的影响。

sentences.english: As the police moved in, the hostages were running out, he said.
sentences.chinese: 随着警方进入该区域，人质也都四散跑出。

sentences.english: Harris went on top in the last lap .
sentences.chinese: 哈利斯在最后一圈跑到了最前面。

sentences.english: She saw the light burning and ran the rest of the way to her house.
sentences.chinese: 她看到点亮的灯光，跑完了剩下的路到了家。

sentences.english: He slipped into his coat and went out.
sentences.chinese: 他敏捷地套上外衣，跑到外面去了。

sentences.english: She shook her head and then started laughing and running again.
sentences.chinese: 她摇摇头，笑了起来，然后又开始跑。

sentences.english: All is not well in the world Susie has left behind.
sentences.chinese: 苏茜走后的世界，一切都跑偏了轨道。

sentences.english: After my noon run, I rushed to the market to buy a lot of different spices.
sentences.chinese: 我中午跑完步之后，马上冲去买一大堆香料。

definition: to run out
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
to run
to sculpt/to carve/musical instrument (old)
to chase after/to seek/to do one's utmost to seek or procure sth/to recall
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to take to one's heels/to scram
to run like the wind/to rush/to gallop
to dash (run fast)/to rush/to dart
to start running/the start of a race
to crawl/to climb/to get up or sit up
horse race/to ride a horse at a fast pace/wet dream
to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)
to run around all over the place
old variant of 往[wang3]
to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous
100-meter dash
to walk/to go on foot
